headline: Mag 7 earnings, PCE data, April jobs report: What to Watch
summary: Here's what investors are watching during the week starting Monday, April 28. "Magnificent Seven" earnings will continue, with Microsoft (MSFT), Meta (META), Apple (AAPL), and Amazon (AMZN) set to release quarterly results throughout the week. The market will receive fresh economic data on Wednesday, when Personal Consumption Expenditure (PCE) data will be released, and on Friday, when the newest jobs report will be released. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Stocks Claw Back Most of April’s Tariff Losses
summary: Stocks finished higher Friday, extending the week’s rally to a fourth day, as investors prepared for a slew of economic data and corporate earnings reports slated for next week.  The market rebound that started Tuesday continued as the week ended with the S&P 500 rising 0.7%, closing above 5500 for the first time since President Trump announced a new tariff regime April 2.  Friday, the president said the U.S. is “very close” to a tariff deal with Japan.

Friday, the president said the U.S. is “very close” to a tariff deal with Japan.

headline: 2 Top Stocks You Can Buy Now With $500
summary: Wall Street's concerns over tariffs and how President Donald Trump's trade wars will impact the U.S. economy have sent the Nasdaq Composite down by around 18% year to date, and it's off more than 20% from its peak.  For less than $500, you can buy one share each of Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL).  The market sell-off has taken Amazon down to $166 per share at the time of this writing.

headline: Will Tariffs Help or Hurt Amazon's Business?
summary: Amazon has, for the most part, been winning -- it's one of the most valuable companies in the world, with a market cap close to $2 trillion.  Tariffs, however, introduce a new risk for the e-commerce giant.  While they might help fend off low-priced rivals from overseas, many of the sellers on Amazon's marketplace will also have to raise prices to offset the impact of tariffs.

raw.headline: Will Tariffs Help or Hurt Amazon's Business?
raw.summary: Amazon has, for the most part, been winning -- it's one of the most valuable companies in the world, with a market cap close to $2 trillion.  Tariffs, however, introduce a new risk for the e-commerce giant.  While they might help fend off low-priced rivals from overseas, many of the sellers on Amazon's marketplace will also have to raise prices to offset the impact of tariffs.

summary: In his final letter as Amazon.com's (NASDAQ:AMZN) CEO, Jeff Bezos left more than business advice — he delivered a message that speaks to anyone fighting to stay authentic in a world built for conformity.
